Articles.Content:
Hey, guys

I just unlocked the giant claw, so I decided it'd be fun to test it out by capturing an asteroid or two, but I can't target them? Grabbing them without being able to target seems excessively hard. Is there a way to target, or if not, a trick to intercepting them without being able to target?

Edited July 14, 2014 by Worst at Video Games NA
Have to started tracking them in the tracking station first yet?

Have to started tracking them in the tracking station first yet?

Is that required? I've never used the tracking station much so I never really thought about it. How does tracking them in the tracking station help me target them mid-flight?

It changes them from unknown objects to named asteroids. It tells you what class asteroid they are (a very rough estimate of mass), and allows you to target them in flight. It also keeps them from despawning.

Edited July 14, 2014 by Master Tao
typo

It changes them from unkown objects to named asteroids. It tells you what class asteroid they are (a very rough estimate of mass), and allows you to target them in flight. It also keeps them from despawning.

Ohhh, okay. That makes sense. Alright. Thanks for the replies, guys! I'll track them in the tracking station so that I can unleash the wrath of the claw upon them.

You need to select them in the Tracking Station and click "Track Object", the button with the satellite dish on it. Then they will switch from "Unknown Object" to "Space Object" or something like that. Then you can target them!

EDIT: Now I know why people keep saying "ninja'd"
And once you're tracking it, you get it listed on the tracking screen as 'First discovered on ....' which is pretty cool
